result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy L Mariani was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On Count #1, the Court IMPOSES AND STAYS 90 DAYS JAIL, consecutive to any other sentence in being and places the Defendant on Probation for 1 year.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Troy L Mariani

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 11:05 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Troy L Mariani in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
ADA Hall submits victim impact statement

On Count #1, the Court IMPOSES AND STAYS 90 DAYS JAIL, consecutive to any other sentence in being and places the Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:
--No contact with Stacy Klockow except as allowed by family court order and the injunction
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random urinalyses
--Maintain absolute sobriety 
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--To pay costs of $243
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge
--Submit DNA Sample if requested (already on file)

Days credit for time already served: 2 days
Recess: 11:25 am
Proposed Stipulation and Order for Continuance

Case called at 1:32-pm. [mo] 
Defendant Troy L Mariani appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. Svehlek indicates that Mr. Mariani IS eligible for PD representation

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial NOT Waived by the Defendant


The Court requires a $500 signature bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Stacy Klockow, except through a third party for purposes on child care and child placement
--Mr. Mariani can return one time to the residence shared with Ms. Klockow accompanied by law enforcement by 8/14/2015 at 6:00pm to retrieve personal belongings
--no acts or threats of violence
--no use of dangerous weapons as described by statute
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.**If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

recess 1:39 pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/2/2015 at 9:00am (2)FSSC: 9/8/2015 at 1:30pm (3)Jury Trial: 9/14/2015 at 8:30am
